document.docAuthor: Sz, Sándor Cs Ő, Radchenko, Alexander & Schulz, Andreas
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of the Palaearctic Tetramorium chefketi species complex (Hymenoptera: Formicidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic revision of the Palaearctic Tetramorium chefketi species complex (Hymenoptera: Formicidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Species belonging to the
T. chefketi
species complex can be defined by the following combination of characters:

a) polygonal striae are continuous on 1 st gastral tergite, and is sometimes microreticulate basally. Polygonal striation: interstices marked by feeble anastomosing striae (Fig. 8 .), compare to microreticulation: interstices marked by very feeble elevated structures, like rugulae (Fig. 6, 7.);
b) head, alitrunk and waist coarsely sculptured, dorsum of petiolar node and postpetiole coarsely rugose and/ or reticulate.
d) ground surface on the frons is usually coarsely microreticulate;
e) alitrunk is low, dorsum is flattened in profile;
f) scutum in dorsal view is somewhat narrowed anteriorly and does not cover completely the pronotum, humeri are well visible;
g) head, alitrunk and waist are coarsely sculptured, and petiole and postpetiole dorsum coarsely rugose or/ and reticulate;
i) mandibles are longitudinally striate;
n) stipes of genitalia blunt, curved inwards at the top, with flattened apical plate (in caudal view);

We placed the following species into the
chefketi
species complex:

1 )
Tetramorium alternans
Santschi, 1929

Tetramorium anatolicum Csősz & Schulz

3 )
Tetramorium annectens
Pisarski, 1969

subSubSection.paragraph:
10 )
Tetramorium syriacum
Emery, 1922

The newly defined
chefketi
species complex may not strictly reflect the phylogenetic relationship of the above­mentioned species.
T. sulcinode
and
T. annectens
possess several autapomorphic characters (e.g. relatively large eyes and a long psammophore) what probably may lead to place them into a separate group in a future.
